teo.isgci.problem

Class Problem

  • java.lang.Object
    • teo.isgci.problem.Problem
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cliquewidth, Recognition

    public class Problem
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores the information about a graph problem.

      • STEPS

        static final int STEPS
        Complexities are deduced in multiple steps, as follows: Repeat twice: - Algorithms for problem on node or on a super/subclass of node. - Derived from previous step by parent/child problems - Derived from previous step by union/intersect/special Derived from previous step by complement problems. Repeat twice: - Algorithms for problem on node or on a super/subclass of node. - Derived from previous step by parent/child problems - Derived from previous step by union/intersect/special
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        Create a problem.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the problem ("Independent set")
        g - the graph of classes for which the problem exists
        complement - the complement of the problem (Clique)

      • getComplexityString

        public java.lang.String getComplexityString(Complexity c)
        Return a string representation of the given complexity. The string chosen depends on whether this problem is a tree/cliquewidth parameter or not.

      • getDerivedComplexity

        public Complexity getDerivedComplexity(GraphClass n)

      • createAlgo

        public Algorithm createAlgo(GraphClass n,
                   Complexity complexity,
                   java.lang.String why)
        Create a new algorithm for this problem on a node n with a simple explanation (Note text), add it to node n and return it. n may be null.

      • getAlgoSet

        protected java.util.HashSet<Algorithm> getAlgoSet(GraphClass n)
        Get the algorithms for this problem that work on node n or null if there are none.

      • getAlgos

        public java.util.Iterator<Algorithm> getAlgos(GraphClass n)
        Return an iterator over the algorithms for this problem on the given node. Never returns null.

      • distributeAlgorithms

        protected void distributeAlgorithms()
        Distribute the Algorithms for this problem over all nodes. initAlgo/addAlgo must have been called for all problems. Assumes the graph is transitively closed!
        Parameters:
        gc2node - maps GraphClass to Node in g

      • distributeParents

        protected void distributeParents()
        Distribute the algorithms for the parents to this problem.

      • distributeChildren

        protected void distributeChildren()
        Distribute the algorithms for the children to this problem.

      • distributeComplement

        public void distributeComplement()
        Distribute the Algorithms for this problem over all nodes via the complement. initAlgo/addAlgo must have been called for all problems. distributeAlgorithms must have been called for this problem, and all parent/child problems. Assumes the graph is transitively closed and the complement index is set!

      • distributeUpUnion

        protected void distributeUpUnion()
        Try moving complexity information UP to union nodes. We only change the complexity class for Union nodes, and do not generate new references or timebounds. The reasoning is: If we can solve the problem for every part of the union in polytime, then we can apply all part algorithms in polytime, and check their solutions in polytime. So the problem is solvable in polytime on the union.

      • distributeDownIntersect

        protected void distributeDownIntersect()
        Try moving complexity information DOWN to intersection nodes. Example: If we can recognize every part of the intersection in polytime/lin, then we can take their conjunction in polytime/lin as well.
        Parameters:
        gc2node - translates a GraphClass into the corresponding ISGCINode

      • distributeSpecial

        protected void distributeSpecial()
        Do special deductions for a particular problem. Default implementation does nothing.

      • distribute

        protected void distribute(java.util.HashSet algos,
              java.lang.Iterable<GraphClass> nodes)
        Adds the algorithms in algos to the classes in nodes.

      • getDerivedAlgo

        protected Algorithm getDerivedAlgo(java.util.List<Algorithm> l,
                       Complexity c,
                       java.lang.String why)
        Find in the given list an algorithm of the requested complexity. If it doesn't exist yet, create it node-independently with the given complexity and text.

      • getComplementAlgo

        protected Algorithm getComplementAlgo(Complexity c)
        Return an algorithm that solves this on a class in time c, assuming the complement can be solved on co-G.

      • setDeducing

        public static void setDeducing()
        Call this before reading the graph when you're going to deduce.

      • distributeComplexitiesBasic

        private static void distributeComplexitiesBasic()
        Perform a single sequence of complexity deductions (3 steps), without complement.

      • distributeComplexities

        public static void distributeComplexities()
        Distribute/deduce the algorithms and complexities.
        Parameters:
        gc2node - maps GraphClass to Node in g
